page.title: 04THE VIADUCT OR FLYOVER I
page.content: { WE CHILDREN ARE VERY PROUD OF OUR NEW VIADUCT CROSSING THE NEWPORT ROAD,THE RHYMNEY RIVER AND THE MAIN LONDON TO CARDIFF RAILWAY LINE.IT WAS OPENED IN THE AUTUMN OF 1984 AND IS PART OF THE LINK ROAD WHICH IS STILL RUN IN A GREAT LOOP TO THE SOUTH OF CARDIFF FROM THE M4 IN THE NORTH-WEST TO THE M4 IN THE NORTH-EAST.IT COST Â£6.7 MILLION AND WAS PAID FOR BY THE SOUTH GLAMORGAN COUNTY COUNCIL,THE WELSH OFFICE AND THE E.E.C. THE VIADUCT IS 950 METRES LONG AND HAS 18 SPANS SUPPORTED ON 17 TWIN PIERS.IT IS A CANTILEVER STYLE OF CONSTRUCTION.THE BOX GIRDERS WHICH CARRY THE ROAD DECK ARE MADE OF PRECAST CONCRETE.THEY ARE 3.3 METRES AND THERE ARE 15 OF THEM BETWEEN THE PIERS.THE BOX GIRDER IN THE CENTRE OF EACH ONE IS CALLED A
